articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Britain warns nationals against travel to Iraq and Iran
articles.description: Britain warned its nationals to avoid all travel to Iraq, outside the Kurdistan region, and to avoid all but essential travel to Iran following the death of Qassem Soleimani.
articles.content:
LONDON (Reuters) - Britain warned its nationals to avoid all travel to Iraq, outside the Kurdistan region, and to avoid all but essential travel to Iran following the death of Qassem Soleimani. 
“Given heightened tensions in the region, the Foreign Office no… [+297 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Authorities warn Australian bushfires developing their own weather systems
articles.description: The bushfires ravaging Australia are generating so much heat that they are creating their own weather systems including dry lighting storms and fire tornadoes.
articles.content:
MELBOURNE (Reuters) - The bushfires ravaging Australia are generating so much heat that they are creating their own weather systems including dry lighting storms and fire tornadoes. 
On Saturday, the New South Wales Rural Fire Service (RFS) warned that a fir… [+1925 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: China banking regulator eases market access for foreign lenders
articles.description: China's banking and insurance regulator (CBIRC) has released new rules which make it easier for foreign lenders to enter the Chinese market.
articles.content:
SHANGHAI (Reuters) - China’s banking and insurance regulator (CBIRC) has released new rules which make it easier for foreign lenders to enter the Chinese market. 
The measures cancel the total asset requirements for foreign banks to set up businesses in Chin… [+798 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Iraq military denies air strike took place on Saturday in Taji
articles.description: Iraq's military denied on Saturday an air strike had taken place on a medical convoy in Taji, north of Baghdad.
articles.content:
BAGHDAD (Reuters) - Iraq’s military denied on Saturday an air strike had taken place on a medical convoy in Taji, north of Baghdad. 
Iraq’s Popular Mobilization Forces umbrella grouping of paramilitary groups had said earlier on Saturday said that an air str… [+235 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: NBA roundup: Harden records triple-double in Rockets win
articles.description: James Harden recorded a 40-point triple-double and Clint Capela won the matchup of talented bigs as the Houston Rockets rolled to a 118-108 victory over the Philadelphia 76ers on Friday night in Houston.
articles.content:
James Harden recorded a 40-point triple-double and Clint Capela won the matchup of talented bigs as the Houston Rockets rolled to a 118-108 victory over the Philadelphia 76ers on Friday night in Houston. 
Harden posted 44 points, 11 rebounds and 11 assists a… [+4037 chars]

articles.author: Maki Shiraki
articles.title: Ghosn fled Japan after security firm hired by Nissan stopped surveillance - sources
articles.description: Ousted Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn left his Tokyo residence after a private security firm hired by Nissan Motor Co stopped monitoring him, three sources familiar with the matter told Reuters on Saturday.
articles.content:
TOKYO (Reuters) - Ousted Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn left his Tokyo residence after a private security firm hired by Nissan Motor Co stopped monitoring him, three sources familiar with the matter told Reuters on Saturday. 
Ghosn has become an international fugi… [+1851 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Thousands gather in Baghdad to mourn Soleimani, others killed in U.S. air strike
articles.description: Thousands of mourners gathered in Baghdad on Saturday ahead of a funeral procession for Iran's slain military commander Qassem Soleimani, Iraqi militia leader Abu Mahdi al-Muhandis and others killed in a Friday U.S. air strike in Iraq.
articles.content:
BAGHDAD (Reuters) - Thousands of mourners gathered in Baghdad on Saturday ahead of a funeral procession for Iran’s slain military commander Qassem Soleimani, Iraqi militia leader Abu Mahdi al-Muhandis and others killed in a Friday U.S. air strike in Iraq.

articles.author: Hyonhee Shin
articles.title: Europe helps secure release of 11 North Korean defectors held in Vietnam - activists
articles.description: A group of 11 North Koreans who were detained in Vietnam while seeking to defect to South Korea have been released thanks to the help of European institutions, a Seoul-based activist group said on Saturday.
articles.content:
SEOUL (Reuters) - A group of 11 North Koreans who were detained in Vietnam while seeking to defect to South Korea have been released thanks to the help of European institutions, a Seoul-based activist group said on Saturday. 
The eight women and three men we… [+2252 chars]

articles.description: The U.S.-led coalition fighting Islamic State said on Saturday it did not conduct any air strikes near Camp Taji north of Baghdad.
